page.title: 09WILLEY PARK FARM CHALDON
page.content:
The farm has 197 acres, 32 acres winter wheat, 50 barley and 110 grass, mainly for silage. In the winter Mr. Blatts grazes sheep from Romney Marsh. He has 20 sheep of his own. He raises cattle, few at present, but intends to raise more in the future. They have geese, ducks, chickens and a llama.
The oldest building is the house, it dates from 1665. The water tower is 150 years old. The silage tower is newer.
Neville Blatts has been at the farm 8 years. He was born in Zimbabwe. His wife was born in England, so were his children.
His worst problem is uncontrolled dogs. Sixteen sheep were killed, and three dogs were put down in 1984.
